message.content:
<<<api>>>: RandomAccessFile.getFilePointer
<<<code>>>: RandomAccessFile file = new RandomAccessFile("file.txt", "r");
long offset = file.getFilePointer();
<<<explanation>>>: The getFilePointer() method returns the current offset in the file where the next read or write operation will occur. By calling this method after each line read, you can get the offset of each line in the file.

<<<api>>>: RandomAccessFile.seek
<<<code>>>: RandomAccessFile file = new RandomAccessFile("file.txt", "r");
long offset = file.getFilePointer();
<<<explanation>>>: Use the RandomAccessFile class to open the file in read mode. Then use the getFilePointer() method to get the current offset in the file.

<<<api>>>: RandomAccessFile.seek

            long offset = 0;
            String line;
            while ((line = file.readLine()) != null) {
                // Process line here
                offset = file.getFilePointer();
            }
<<<explanation>>>: Use the RandomAccessFile class to read the file. Use the seek method to set the file pointer to the desired offset. Use the getFilePointer method to get the current offset.

<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: How to get the last value of an ArrayList: How to get the last value of an ArrayList?
Please using this api: List.get.
Answer:<<<api>>>: List.get
<<<code>>>: E e = list.get(list.size() - 1);
<<<explanation>>>: First get the size of the list, then the last element is at index size - 1.
